item.title: Daily Login Rewards–October 2023
item.description: See what goodies you can claim simply by logging in to ESO during the month of October 2023.
item.content:encoded:
See what goodies you can claim simply by logging in to ESO during the month of October 2023.

If you're planning to spend some time in Tamriel this October, there's 31 great reasons why you should log in to The Elder Scrolls Online. You can see just some of the daily rewards you can claim next month below, but if you'd like to find out more about Daily Login Rewards in general, check out this help article.

Grand Gold Coast Experience Scroll ×2—Day 7

Level up quick!

Get ready to dive into the Endless Archive by leveling up fast with two EXP Scrolls, each granting a 150% boost to experience gains.

Seals of Endeavor ×250—Day 14

Claim 250 of these on day 14!

Got your eye on any Crown Crate items? In its first appearance for the Daily Rewards system, Seals of Endeavor were previously earned only by completing daily and weekly Endeavors. You can learn more about Seals of Endeavor in this blog.

Ash Hopper Chomp Emote—Day 21

A Green Pact-approved meal

Ash hoppers are typically native to Vvardenfell (but certainly found in other equally inhospitable locations), so it is perhaps unsurprising that the Dark Elves have incorporated these creatures into their already formidable local cuisine. This emote proves once more that there's no accounting for taste.

These are just some of the rewards you can claim during October, so be sure to log in to the game on the first day of the month to see the complete list. You can find it within the Daily Rewards section of the in-game Crown Store. Do any of these items tickle your fancy? Will you be taking a big bite out of some giant insect legs? Let us know via Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook!

item.title: Japanese Localization Arrives on Consoles with ESO's Update 40
item.description: ESO's console players will be able to enjoy Japanese localization with the Update 40 base-game patch!
item.content:encoded:
ESO's console players will be able to enjoy Japanese localization with the Update 40 base-game patch!

We are very excited to share that The Elder Scrolls Online will launch fully localized in Japanese for Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, and PlayStation 5 consoles with the release of Update 40 on November 14, 2023 (November 15 local Tokyo time).

During last night's Xbox Digital Broadcast from the Tokyo Game Show, Creative Director Rich Lambert thanked the Japanese community and highlighted the game's most recent Chapter, The Elder Scrolls Online: Necrom, which players will be able to play translated into Japanese this November.

As shared during the recent preview livestream, the Update 40 base-game patch arrives November 14 (November 15 local Tokyo time) on console and includes the new Endless Archive PvE activity and a host of quality-of-life additions and fixes. As a base-game update, Update 40 is free for all existing ESO players, with no additional purchases required.

item.title: Defend the Warrior Poet with Items from the New Buoyant Armiger Crown Crates
item.description: Stand sentinel over the Tribunal Temple and Lord Vivec with the items and collectibles found within the new Buoyant Armiger Crown Crates.
item.content:encoded:
Stand sentinel over the Tribunal Temple and Lord Vivec with the items and collectibles found within the new Buoyant Armiger Crown Crates.

***

“Poetry is the sharpest blade a warrior can wield. Do you have the wherewithal to stand your ground, as does a proud kwama queen? Or do you offer your throat as the gentle guar? Take up the glassine armor of the Buoyant Armiger in service to Lord Vivec!

And in return for your service and artistry? Ride forth with treasures from the Telvanni Peninsula. Arm yourself with flair and panache, or seek the best the mycoturges have to offer. This is your moment, Armiger. In Vehk's name!”

***

The new Buoyant Armiger Crown Crates arrive in the Crown Store this Thursday, September 21 at 10AM EDT. When claiming one of these new crates, Vivec's finest have a chance to acquire a selection of new and returning collectibles and items, fit for Vehk himself.

These goods include unique mounts, pets, furnishings, and much more. You can see just some of the items available within Buoyant Armiger Crown Crates below.

Necrom Armiger body markings & Necrom Evening Attire costume

Armiger Axing customized action & Chaotic Creatia Cub pet

Should Vivec's own fortune find you when opening a Buoyant Armiger crate, you might even unlock one of the below extremely rare Radiant Apex mounts.

Necrom Armiger Senche & Harrowstorm Destrier mounts

Spellscar Quasigriff mount

Buoyant Armiger Crown Crates will be available in one-, four-, and 15-crate bundles in addition to two unique bundles that include Spellscar items.

  • The Spellscar's Kiss Crate Bundle
    • Including 25 Buoyant Armiger crates and the Spellscar Sheathe skin
  • The Spellscar's Hiss Crate Bundle
    • Including five Buoyant Armiger crates and the Spellscar Salamander pet

The Spellscar's Kiss and Spellscar's Hiss bundles

Upon purchase of either one of these special bundles, the skin or pet will be unlocked automatically and added to your collectibles. These bundles can be purchased only once each.

Of course, the above are just some of the blessings Vivec can bestow upon his most-trusted guardians. If you wish to see the full list of items you have a chance to receive when opening a Buoyant Armiger Crown Crate, check out this thread on our official forums.

Be warned, when the new crates go live, the currently available Unfeathered Crown Crates will be removed from the Crown Store in turn, so don't forget to pick them up while they're still available!

Buoyant Armiger Crown Crates arrive this Thursday, September 21 at 10AM EDT, and can be acquired from the Crown Crate section of the in-game Crown Store. Are you ready and willing to stand sentinel and protect the Warrior Poet himself? Let us know if you're excited to become one of Vivec's chosen via Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook.

item.title: Endless Archive & Update 40 Now Available on the PC/Mac Public Test Server!
item.description: Join us on the Public Test Server to try out the new Endless Archive PvE activity and Update 40 base-game patch!
item.content:encoded:
Join us on the Public Test Server to try out the new Endless Archive PvE activity and Update 40 base-game patch!

The Update 40 base-game patch is now live on the Public Test Server (PTS) and is accessible via the PC/Mac ESO launcher. This base-game update, free to all players, includes the Endless Archive PvE activity. Want to help us test Update 40 and this new dungeon-like challenge? Log in to the PTS!

To access the PTS, open the Settings menu located within the PC/Mac ESO launcher and click on the “Show Public Test Environment.” Once you've downloaded everything, you'll be able to access the testing server. While you're exploring the PTS, don't forget to leave feedback and report any bugs you come across by typing “/feedback” or “/bug” through the in-game chat.

If you want to learn more about the new challenges that await you in within the infinite halls of the Endless Archive or anything else arriving with the Update 40 patch, be sure to check out our recent preview livestream and PTS Patch Notes on the ESO forums.

Are you ready to take your first steps into the Endless Archive? Let us know via Twitter, Instagram, or Facebook!

Update 40 base-game patch, including the Endless Archive, arrives on October 30 for PC/Mac and November 14 for Xbox and PlayStation consoles.

item.title: Update 39 Base-Game Patch Now Live on All Platforms
item.description: Discover the host of additions and improvements arriving with the free Update 39 base-game patch.
item.content:encoded:
Discover the host of additions and improvements arriving with the free Update 39 base-game patch.

The Update 39 base-game patch is now live PC/Mac, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, and PlayStation 5, and introduces a series of long-awaited improvements and additions to The Elder Scrolls Online, completely free of charge for all existing ESO players.

Update 39 Base Game Improvements

As a base-game patch, Update 39 includes a wide array of bug fixes, but also features a series of long-awaited improvements to your in-game experience.

Quest & Content Improvements for New Players

If you're a new player feeling overwhelmed when first entering Tamriel, you can enjoy a series of changes that reduce the volume and frequency of quests offered to your low-level characters. This includes quests from NPCs for the main story, Fighters Guild, Mages Guild, Battlegrounds, Undaunted, and others. Instead, these quests are now delivered more gradually as you level up, helping your journal stay in a manageable state for longer!

Tamriel's navigator NPCs that can transport your characters between destinations have also received some improvements with this update. Now, these navigators indicate whether they can transport you to a location for one of your tracked quests (active or inactive.) When exploring, you now see the “door” pin above relevant navigator NPCs, indicating that they can help you in your journey. In addition, appropriate dialog lines with those same NPCs have similar pins, ensuring you make the right choice and go where you need to go—happy travels!

Taking your first steps into Tamriel is daunting

Inventory Management Improvements

If you're struggling with an overburdened Inventory, Update 39 also includes changes to key item types to help improve management and reduce clutter. Some (but not all) similar Crown Store items that came from separate sources (such as Tri-Restoration Potions) can now all be stacked together using the “Stack All Items” option. Also, this patch adds better communication regarding which items in your Inventory can or cannot be sold, helping you identify and clear out unwanted items and make a little gold in the process!

PvP Additions & New Rewards

This update adds new rewards for Tamriel's PvP victors in the form of three new monster mask sets: Jerall Mountains Warchief, Nibenay Bay Battlereeve, and Colovian Highlands General. Each grants unique and powerful boons, and you can trade Alliance Points for these new masks with Cyrodiil Elite Gear Vendors within the Eastern Elsweyr Gate, Southern High Rock Gate, and Northern Morrowind Gate.

Chase down new PvP rewards

In addition, you can now claim new Unfeathered Battle Body and Face Markings from Gladiator's Rucksacks (earned by completing Cyrodiil Conquest Mission Board daily quests), and the Imperial City's hapless Treasure Scamps now drop even better loot when hunted down. In particular, Cunning Scamps drop more Tel Var Stones and Trove Scamps drop tradable pieces of Imperial City gear sets.

Finally, while battling in Cyrodiil, the Imperial City, and Battlegrounds, you can now see new death notifications that help you plan your next move (or avoid that incoming zerg!).

Home Editor Improvements

With Update 39, this patch gives you the ability to place a furnishing directly from your Inventory or Collectibles UI while in your home. You can now find a “Place” option when viewing the specific furnishings. In addition, you can preview Crown Store furnishings in your home before you buy, helping you determine how a new item might look when placed.

Place furnishings from Inventory and Collectibles

Of course, these are just some of the changes and additions that arrive with Update 39. To see a complete list of everything this new base-game patch introduces to ESO, visit our Patch Notes forum.


Getting Started in Update 39

As a base-game update, your version of ESO automatically updates on PC/Mac via the ESO Launcher. Note that to run ESO on PC/Mac, your machine needs to meet the game's requirements here: PC, Mac. Don't forget, Update 39 arrives on consoles September 5.

As mentioned above, this is a free base-game update for all ESO players. Anybody with access to the game can download and enjoy these new additions and changes. There is no previous purchase required (aside from the game itself).

Tamriel Evolves

With the free Update 39 base-game patch, you can enjoy the above improvements and more to help you get the most out of your time in Tamriel. Which of the above changes and additions are you most excited to experience? Let us know via Twitter, Instagram, or Facebook.

The Update 39 base-game patch is now live PC/Mac, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, and PlayStation 5.

item.title: Dungeon Delvers Rejoice! The Undaunted Celebration Event Returns
item.description: Get bonus rewards when you explore Tamriel's four-player dungeons during the Undaunted Celebration in-game event.
item.content:encoded:
Get bonus rewards when you explore Tamriel's four-player dungeons during the Undaunted Celebration in-game event.

Group Up for Adventure

The Undaunted Celebration begins Thursday, September 7 at 10AM EDT, and runs until Tuesday, September 19 at 10AM EDT. Throughout this PvE in-game event, you and your intrepid band earn special rewards and Event Tickets by delving into any of ESO's group dungeons.

Once the event begins, you can head into Tamriel's dungeons via your map, the Activity Finder, or any dungeon entrance. In addition, you can acquire the introductory quest “Glory of the Undaunted” by speaking to Serileth at any Undaunted Enclave, traveling to an Impresario tent, or free from the in-game Crown Store.

Look for Serileth!

Undaunted Rewards

Tamriel's dungeons are challenging PvE encounters, but throughout the event, big dangers can also lead to big rewards. The first time you complete a dungeon each day throughout the Undaunted Celebration, you receive a Glorious Undaunted Reward Box as an additional loot drop. You can open this unique container to receive various reward items including gold, consumables, style pages, Undaunted Keys, Opal Weapon styles, and more.

Slay bosses for bonus rewards

After you have defeated your first final dungeon boss each day, keep going! Subsequent final dungeon bosses reward regular Undaunted Reward boxes, which can include the following goods:

  • A guaranteed drop of an item set piece from the dungeon in which the box was acquired.
  • A guaranteed drop of one of the following items:
    • A random motif style page from the following:
      • Ascendant Order
      • Bloodforge
      • Crimson Oath
      • Dreadsail
      • Fang Lair
      • Huntsman
      • Hazardous Alchemy
      • Icereach
      • Mazzatun
      • Moongrave Fane
      • Pyre Watch
      • Silken Ring
      • Scalecaller
      • Silver Dawn
      • Stags of Z'en
      • Silver Rose
      • Thorn Legion
      • True Sworn
      • Waking Flame
  • 1,000 Gold
  • An Undaunted Key
  • A Crown Repair Kit
  • A Riding Lesson

The daily Glorious Undaunted Reward Box can contain any of the above items, but it also has a chance to drop one of the following:

  • Opal monster weapon styles for:
    • NEW Sentinel of Rkugamz
    • Velidreth
    • Iceheart
    • Lord Warden
    • Nightflame
    • Swarm Mother

Regular Undaunted Reward Boxes can also be earned by complete Bolgrul's (found within any Undaunted Enclave) Daily Undaunted Delve quest.

Earn Opal style pages

Opal Monster Mask Style Pages

During the event, when you defeat and loot a specific dungeon's final boss on veteran hard mode, you'll also enjoy a greater chance to loot its associated Opal Monster Mask style page. This includes the following bosses and dungeons:

  • Sentinel of Rkugamz (Darkshade Caverns I)
  • Velidreth (Cradle of Shadows)
  • Iceheart (Direfrost Keep)
  • Lord Warden (Imperial City Prison)
  • Nightflame (Elden Hollow II)

Opal Monster Shoulder Outfit Style Pages

If you own a base version of a monster shoulder style, you can also acquire the Opal version of that same style from Undaunted vendors at a cost of Undaunted Keys. Specific Opal style pages cost 50 keys, while special coffers with a random Opal Shoulder style page cost 25.

Impresario Stocks Up

During the Undaunted Celebration, you can earn two Event Tickets for defeating your first final dungeon boss each day. Note that with the Update 39 base-game patch, should you fail to loot your Event Tickets for whatever reason, you will be granted subsequent opportunities to loot your daily Event Tickets from other sources. Don't forget you can loot only two Event Tickets per day during the event, but now your chances of missing out on your daily allotment are minimized.

During the event, you can spend your Event Tickets at the Impresario vendor to acquire the following items:

  • All three Passion Dancer Blossom pet fragments
    • Chartreuse Lily Petals
    • Enchanted Silver Flute
    • Mystical Sheet Music
  • The first TWO Passion Dancer's Garment costume fragments
    • Bolt of Indigo Cotton
    • Bolt of Silver Silk
  • Bound style pages for the Sentinel of Rkugamz Opal weapons and Opal masks and shoulders
  • Impresario Group Repair Kits
  • Companion Guild Commendations

Passion Dancer's Garment

In addition, the Impresario's Assistant will stock:

  • All three Unstable Morpholith pet fragments
    • Deadlands Flint
    • Rune-Etched Striker
    • Smoldering Bloodgrass Tinder
  • All three Deadlands Firewalker personality fragments
    • Vial of Simmering Daedric Brew
    • Vial of Bubbling Daedric Brew
    • Vial of Scalding Daedric Brew
  • Finally, the Indrik vendor Nenulaure will have:
    • Nascent Indrik Feathers
    • Onyx Indrik Berries
    • Mossheart Indrik Berries
    • Ebon-Glow Indrik Pet
    • Sapling Indrik Pet

Undaunted, Undaunted!

Who knows no fear of beast or blade? Undaunted! Delve into Tamriel's dungeons, defeat final bosses, and collect shiny event-specific rewards during the Undaunted Celebration in-game event. Is your party ready to venture forth into some of ESO's toughest PvE content? Let us know via Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook.

The Undaunted Celebration begins Thursday, September 7 from 10AM EDT, and runs until Tuesday, September 19 at 10AM EDT.

item.title: Get Ready for the PC/Mac Launcher Update & Beta
item.description: An update to your ESO PC/Mac Launcher is coming soon. Here's everything you need to know about this long-awaited optimization.
item.content:encoded:
An update to your ESO PC/Mac Launcher is coming soon. Here's everything you need to know about this long-awaited optimization.

Your Launcher, Improved

Over the last few months, the team has been hard at work implementing a host of new features and improvements to ESO's PC/Mac Launcher. After a successful series of tests on the Public Test Server, we're almost ready to roll this update out via an open beta. Curious as to what this update brings to the launcher? Check out the full list of the changes and additions below!

  • Patching and installing ESO is faster, more efficient, and has fewer patching steps.
  • Invalid file issues are more consistently caught for repairs.
  • The Launcher window can be scaled, increasing text size.
  • The Launcher now supports keyboard and gamepad navigation.
  • New options in the Settings Menu:
    • Obsolete File Checker (automatically checks your Launcher installation directory for outdated or unneeded files and proposes to remove them to save space and prevent future errors).
    • Log File Locator.
    • Error messaging presents clearer details on internal launcher issues.
  • Visual changes on the loading bar while patching, including the following:
    • Display disk speed.
    • Display network speed.
    • All progress is displayed through a single loading bar.
  • Resolution scaling, including 4K support.
  • A new Accessibility Settings menu.
    • Accessed via a new head-shaped button to the left of the cog-shaped Settings Menu button.

The updated ESO Launcher

Getting the Update

This update will roll out gradually over select territories as part of a public beta period. When your territory's launcher is in beta, you will be able to enable the new version by following these steps:

  1. Open the Launcher and click on the cog-shaped Settings Menu button
  2. Select the Launcher Beta option
  3. Select the Upgrade button, and confirm
  4. Allow the Launcher to update itself and reload
  5. Check the “Beta” flag next to the Accessibility icon to confirm it is updated

Upgrade to the beta

Note that Epic Games Store players cannot update their launchers at this time. Keep an eye out for more information regarding the Epic Games Store and launcher in the future.

The beta's full duration is to be determined, but during this period, you can move back and forth between the old and new version of the launcher at will via the Settings Menu.

Once the beta period has ended, ALL PC/Mac ESO players will need to update their launchers. This will occur automatically. To see when your territory is enabling the beta update, keep an eye on this forum thread.

We're excited to bring the updated ESO PC/Mac Launcher to Tamriel's adventures, and we look forward to receiving your thoughts and feedback on the upcoming changes. Be sure to tell us what you think of these changes via Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook.

Take a peek at the massive wave of new and returning items arriving in the Crown Store this September.

This September's Crown Store additions are featured below, but you can always review all the items currently on sale by checking out the Crown Store page. Be sure to visit the Buy Crowns page beforehand to pick up however many crowns you need. Certain items and offers will be time-limited throughout the month, so be sure to read their individual details below to ensure you don't miss out.


ESO Plus Deals


All ESO Plus™ members have access to a monthly selection of exclusive deals and items. You can find more information about them in this article.

Exclusive Free Items

Statuette: Mora, Lord of Secrets

All statues of the Inevitable Knower are, after a fashion, access points from Apocrypha to Nirn. Given that, go carefully as you invite Hermaeus Mora into your home.

The Statuette: Mora, Lord of Secrets will be available in the Crown Store FREE exclusively to ESO Plus Members on all platforms for a limited time, from September 7 to October 12, 2023, at 10AM EDT.


Crown Gem and Seals of Endeavor Items

Pet

Amaranthine Pocket Watcher

"My notes indicate these vibrantly hued watchers once inhabited the ruins of Zaintiraris until an unfortunate explorer set them free. Given their color and origin, I suspect Sheogorath holds some sway over them. Also unfortunate."—Warlock Aldaale

The Amaranthine Pocket Watcher pet will be available for Crown Gems and Seals of Endeavor on all platforms for a limited time, from September 5 to October 2, 2023, at 10AM EDT.


Crafting

Motifs

Crown Crafting Motif: Clan Dreamcarver

Flaminius Auctor of the Fighters Guild writes, “Since the Dreamcarvers delight in turning our own fears against us, it's only fair to turn their weapons against them....” Use to learn the Clan Dreamcarver crafting style. Also has a chance to drop by completing weekly coffers from Sanity's Edge.

The Crown Crafting Motif: Clan Dreamcarver will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 13, 2023 at 10AM EDT. The Clan Dreamcarvers chapters, and very rarely the complete book, have a chance to drop from Sanity's Edge Treasure Coffers, awarded from Wizard Twelvane in the Sanity's Edge trial from completing the weekly quest “War Within”.


Crown Crafting Motif: Order of the Hour Style

Amminus Entius, First Quartermaster of the Hour, writes, “The Order of the Hour is the defensive arm of the Chantry of Akatosh, and as well-disciplined knights of the Order, you must at all times properly represent the dignity and glory of the ancient Imperial worship of the Dragon God of Time.” Use to learn the Order of the Hour crafting style.

The Crown Crafting Motif: Order Hour Style will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 25, 2023 to October 2, 2023 at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. The Order Hour chapters, and very rarely the complete book, have a chance to drop from Gold Coast Daily Contract Recompenses, awarded from Codus ap Dugal in the Kvatch Arena.


Outfit Styles

Elder Scrolls Artifact: Bow of Shadows

Alter your bow's Outfit style with a replica of the Bow of Shadows Elder Scrolls Artifact, a weapon created by the Daedric Prince Nocturnal.

The Elder Scrolls Artifact: Bow of Shadows will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 5, 2023, to September 11, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Vinedusk Assassin Armor Pack

Hailing from Reaper's March, these members of the Vinedusk Rangers specialize in using an assassin's techniques to keep the peace for the High King of Valenwood. Alter your armor's appearance by using this complete set of Vinedusk Assassin Outfit styles.

The Vinedusk Assassin Armor Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 7, 2023, to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT.


Slimecraw Arms Pack

Declare your intent to deal with the legendary crocodile of the Wayrest Sewers and you may just find the Undaunted cheering you on! Alter your weapon's appearance to match the Undaunted Slimecraw awards by using this complete set of Outfit styles.

The Slimecraw Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 7, 2023, to September 11, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. The matching mask page will have a small chance to drop from Allene Pellingare from Veteran Wayrest Sewers I. The matching shoulder page can be purchased from Maj al-Ragath for 50 undaunted keys, or has a chance of dropping from Maj's Mystery Coffer for 1 key. Having the achievement “Down the Gutter” increases the drop chances of both items.


Tremorscale Arms Pack

Brazzideh of Wayrest claims that Volenfell's giant duneripper earned its name after it nearly wiped out a group of Undaunted hopefuls by rupturing the ground under their very feet! Alter your weapon's appearance to match the Undaunted Tremorscale awards by using this complete set of Outfit styles.

The Tremorscale Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 7, 2023, to September 11, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. The matching mask page will have a small chance to drop from the Guardian Constructs from Veteran Volenfell. The matching shoulder page can be purchased from Glirion the Redbeard for 50 undaunted keys, or has a chance of dropping from Glirion's Mystery Coffer for 1 key. Having the achievement “They Were Just Rusty” increases the drop chances of both items.


Kra'gh Arms Pack

Nessa Inkskin of Elden Root warns, “Enter Fungal Grotto with care, friends. Pay special mind to the dreugh king named Kra'gh, who uses mudcrabs to help tear foes apart.” Alter your weapon's appearance to match the Undaunted Kra'gh awards by using this set of Outfit styles.

The Kra'gh Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 11, 2023, to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. The matching mask page will have a small chance to drop from the Dreugh King from Veteran Fungal Grotto I. The matching shoulder page can be purchased from Maj al-Ragath for 50 undaunted keys, or has a chance of dropping from Maj's Mystery Coffer for 1 key. Having the achievement “Catch of the Day” increases the drop chances of both items.


Velidreth Arms Pack

Also known as the Lady of Lace, the hoarvor Daedroth named Velidreth lurks in the Cradle of Shadows and uses the darkness to her advantage—or so says Roaring Ramavel of the Undaunted. Alter your weapon's appearance to match the Undaunted Velidreth awards by using this set of Outfit styles.

The Velidreth Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 11, 2023, to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. The matching mask page will have a small chance to drop from the eponymous boss from Veteran Cradle of Shadows. The matching shoulder page can be purchased from Urgarlag Chief-bane for 50 undaunted keys, or has a chance of dropping from Urgarlag's Mystery Coffer for 1 key. Having the achievement “Velidreth's Vengence” increases the drop chances of both items.


Bloodspawn Arms Pack

Spindleclutch's deadly gargoyle Bloodspawn continues to add to its tally of victories, making it one of several foes the Undaunted seek to challenge. Alter your weapon's appearance to match the Undaunted Bloodspawn awards by using this complete set of Outfit styles.

The Bloodspawn Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 14, 2023, to September 19, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. The matching mask page will have a small chance to drop from Vorenor Winterbourne from veteran Spindleclutch II. The matching shoulder page can be purchased from Maj al-Ragath. for 50 undaunted keys, or has a chance of dropping from Maj's Mystery Coffer for 1 key. Having the achievement “Compassionate Hero” increases the drop chances of both items.


Infernal Guardian Arms Pack

Akgruhl gra-Bol of the Undaunted writes, “Scholars want to study how the Infernal Guardian, the fire-hardened lurcher within the City of Ash, came about. I would rather study how it comes undone.” Alter your weapon's appearance to match the Undaunted Infernal Guardian awards by using this set of Outfit styles.

The Infernal Guardian Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 14, 2023, to September 19, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. The matching mask page will have a small chance to drop from Razor Master Erthas from veteran City of Ash I. The matching shoulder page can be purchased from Glirion the Redbeard for 50 undaunted keys, or has a chance of dropping from Glirion's Mystery Coffer for 1 key. Having the achievement “Fire Brigade” increases the drop chances of both items.


Apocrypha Expedition Arms Pack

The key to adventuring within Apocrypha, Hermaeus Mora's realm, is to prepare properly. Gear up, and pay special attention to your armaments. Alter your weapon's appearance by using this complete set of Apocrypha Expedition Outfit styles.

The Apocrypha Expedition Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms during the Secrets of the Telvanni event. During the event, matching armor pages will have a small chance to drop from Secret Telvanni Coffers (regular and sublime). Bound versions of the armor pages can be purchased from the Impresario for 5 Event Tickets each during the event.


Wardrobe

Costumes

Magnifica's Sundas Wear

"In Hammerfell, our Crown nobility prefer clothing simple and traditional in cut, but rich and varied in material," says designer Sar'aq of Sentinel. "This ensemble is appropriate for both receiving noble guests and visiting others."

The Magnifica's Sundas Wear will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 5 to September 11, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Treasure Hunter

The serious treasure hunter knows it's really all about the gear. Whether you're exploring subterranean catacombs, ancient ruins, or a shattered shipwreck, when you run into an obstacle, you want to have the right tool at hand.

The Treasure Hunter costume will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 7 to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Eternity Tunic with Pants

In Orsinium these days, even the busiest tusker likes some flair in his clothing—and nothing says "modern Orc" like a bias-cut-placket tunic from Borzighu at Coldsnap Clothiers. "This outfit," he says, "is one for the ages!"

The Eternity Tunic with Pants will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 11 to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Dungeon Explorer

Ready to adventure in places filled with hideous monsters, traps, and other surprises? Dress appropriately with the Dungeon Explorer costume!

The Dungeon Explorer costume will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 14 to September 21, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Treethane's Mosaic Jerkin

The thousands of small shiny particles that decorate the Treethane's Mosaic Jerkin may appear at first glance to be of turquoise or other precious stones, but they are actually the iridescent carapaces of deep forest beetles.

The Treethane's Mosaic Jerkin will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 18 to September 21, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Ashlander Pack

The costumes in this pack replicate the garb of the nomadic Ashlander tribes of Morrowind, including the travel and hunting clothes of the Mabrigash tribe, and the armor of the Kagesh.

The Ashlander Pack costume will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 28 to October 5, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Events

Currency

Event Tickets

A ticket used to purchase rare goods from The Impresario, Event Merchant. Curious as to what goods? Well, chat with her to see what she has to offer!

Single Event Tickets will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time during the Undaunted Celebration and Secrets of the Telvanni. Stay tuned for event details!


Furniture

Music Box, High Isle Duel

When activated, plays a music box arrangement of the dramatic "High Isle Duel" composition.

The Music Box, High Isle Duel will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 7 to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Furnishing Pack: Moons-Blessed Oasis

Bring the stark beauty of an Anequine oasis to your courtyard with this bundle of Elsweyr plants and statuary, complete with a luminous fountain blessed by Jone and Jode.

The Furnishing Pack: Moons-Blessed Oasis will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 28 to October 12, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Statue, Kaalgrontiid's Ascent

This statue of the mighty Dragon Kaalgrontiid shows him ascending majestically and breathing flame, frost, lightning, and even aeonfire from his position of dominance.

The Statue, Kaalgrontiid's Ascent will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 28 to October 12, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Houses

Highhallow Hold

Variously held by both House Dufort and Mornard, this stately manor near the edge of Gonfalon Bay is now available to the adventurer-about-town. It commands a majestic view of the water and provides easy access to the jewel of High Isle.

Highhallow Hold will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 7 to September 21, 2023, at 10AM EDT. Furnished and unfurnished versions will be available.


Hunter's Glade

The underground entrance way leads through a portal to an expansive forested glade in Hircine's Oblivion realm of The Hunting Grounds. Those "blessed" with lycanthropy can maintain werewolf form indefinitely in this otherworldly wilderness.

Hunter's Glade will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 18 to October 2, 2023, at 10AM EDT. Furnished and unfurnished versions will be available.


Jode's Embrace

Few adeptoriums can match the hallowed majesty of Jode's Embrace. Rumor has it that the temple's worthiest occupants can peer into the sacred realm of Jode itself. Just keep an eye out for Dragons overhead!

Jode's Embrace will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 28 to October 12, 2023, at 10AM EDT. Furnished and unfurnished versions will be available.


Houseguests

Skordo the Knife

This Orc mercenary usually keeps busy, but now he wants some actual quiet time. Not to reflect, though—his well-used gear needs some attention. After adding Skordo to your home, you can set him on a path, plus you and your visitors can speak with him.

Skordo the Knife will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 7 to September 21, 2023, at 10AM EDT.


Sereyne

An outlaw with a talent for magic but a thirst for alcohol, Sereyne wants a cozy place to drink her troubles away. Perhaps you can provide? After adding Sereyne to your home, you can set her on a path, plus you and your visitors can speak with her.

Sereyne will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 28 to October 12, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Mounts

Treasure Hunter's Horse

Stolid, careful, sturdy, and long-suffering, the Treasure Hunter's Horse is resigned to a life of being ridden into crumbling ruins by a reckless master who's searching for wealth but often finds only danger.

The Treasure Hunter's Horse will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 7 to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Iron Orc Welwa

Iron Orcs labor hard and long, fight until their dying breath, and train mounts to do the same. So, if you're lucky enough to ride one of their welwas, expect to be pushed to your own limits as your mount keeps going despite all obstacles in its path.

The Iron Orc Welwa mount will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 14 to September 21, 2023, at 10AM EDT.


Hew's Bane Pillion Palfrey

Smuggler crews in Hew's Bane first trained these palfreys to bear two riders. Originally, the training was just a cover story to hide their illicit work. But they quickly found having a mount that could hold two extremely useful for heists.

The Hew's Bane Pillion Palfrey mount will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 28 to October 5, 2023, at 10AM EDT.


Customized Action

Recall of the Crusader

Let the fire of righteousness kindle within your heart. Let that flame carry you to your next worthy endeavor.

The Recall of the Crusader will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting September 14, 2023 at 10AM EDT.

Pets

Badger Ruff Echalette

Most Echalettes are docile and fawn-like, but not the Badger Ruff breed, which are strangely fierce and irritable. They're so ornery they've been known to chase away inquisitive Sabre Cats.

The Badger Ruff Echalette pet will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 5 to September 11, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Pocket Mammoth

Pocket Mammoths were originally bred small in order to make them more manageable as livestock, but in Wrothgar some escaped and began breeding in the wild. However, they're easily domesticated, especially if you get one when it's young.

The Pocket Mammoth pet will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 11 to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Albinoscript Fangtome

Fangtomes know not the importance or content of the books they inhabit. In the event that your rare first editions or vital academic texts have gained a tenant, simply befriend the tome via ample spine massages and a gentle ruffling of its pages.

The Albinoscript Fangtome pet will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 14 to September 21, 2023, at 10AM EDT.


Clockwork Skeevaton

Originally designed for probing tiny, inaccessible areas of the Clockwork City, the mechanical Skeevaton can be set to recognize and follow an individual mortal, replicating pet behavior on the surface of Nirn.

The Clockwork Skeevaton pet will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 25 to September 28, 2023, at 10AM EDT. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Personalities

Treasure Hunter

As a Treasure Hunter, forever poking around in shadowy nooks and crannies for loose gems, lost journals, and hidden levers, what could be more important to you than your trusty ever-burning torch? Never again be lost in the dark without it!

The Treasure Hunter personality will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from September 7 to September 14, 2023, at 10AM EDT.


All-new and unending challenges are on the horizon for Tamriel's adventurers, and the above goods may come in handy for when you delve into the infinite unknown. Don't forget, before making a move to acquire any of these items, you should head over to the Buy Crowns page. Are you eager to pick up any of the above items this September? Let us know via Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook.

item.title: Dungeon Finder Known Issues
item.content:encoded:
Hi all,

We wanted to give everyone some visibility into a couple of issues we are currently tracking involving the Dungeon Finder.

The first is a recurring issue where some group members appear to be offline after you port into a dungeon or are not ported at all. We've been working on a fix for this that will hopefully make it into U39.

The other issue relates to queueing as a group for a dungeon, specifically as a Tank or Healer. We've seen reports where these roles take longer than intended to get matched into a group, and after some investigating, we found there is indeed a problem here when certain conditions are met. While we work on addressing this, we want to offer some additional information that you can leverage as a workaround in the meantime:
  • In 3-person groups:
    • Tank, Healer and Direct Damage (DD) combination: If the Tank or Healer is the group lead, the LFG queue times will be significantly longer than if the DD is the group lead.
    • 2 DD and a Healer, or 2 DD and a Tank: If the Tank or Healer is group lead, the LFG queue times will be slightly longer than if the DD is the group lead, but to a much lesser extent than the Tank/Healer/DD combo above.
  • 4-person groups do not appear to be impacted by this issue in any way.
Until we can get a fix for this, we suggest queuing up with the DD as group leader for any 3 person groups so you get through the queues much quicker.
